edu.washington.cs.touchfreelibrary.touchemulation
Class GestureScroller

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.touchfreelibrary.touchemulation.GestureScroller
All Implemented Interfaces:
CameraGestureSensor.Listener
public class GestureScroller
extends java.lang.Object
implements CameraGestureSensor.Listener

Class GestureScroller emulates the swipe-to-scroll touch-screen gesture with CameraGestureSensor's gestures. Users of this class must set this as a Listener to an external GestureSensor class.

Author:
Leeran Raphaely

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

GestureScroller

public GestureScroller()
Creates a new instance of GestureScroller. In order to function, this must be set as a listener to a CameraGestureSensor object. Also, start() must be called to activate.

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Activates this instance of GestureScroller.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the instance from acting as a cursor, which will no longer be drawn on the view.

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Get whether or not this instance is currently activated

Returns:
true if this is running, false otherwise.

setVerticalPointsWithView

public void setVerticalPointsWithView(View view,
                                      int margins)
Sets the top and bottom points based on a view. The view must already be placed somewhere on the screen for this method to work successfully.

Parameters:
view - The view that will be used to set the scrolling points.
margins - The number of pixels within the view that the points will be offset by vertically.

setHorizontalPointsWithView

public void setHorizontalPointsWithView(View view,
                                        int margins)
Sets the left and right points based on a view. The view must already be placed somewhere on the screen for this method to work successfully.

Parameters:
view - The view that will be used to set the scrolling points.
margins - The number of pixels within the view that the points will be offset by horizontally.

Description copied from interface: CameraGestureSensor.Listener
Called when an up gesture is triggered

Specified by:
onGestureUp in interface CameraGestureSensor.Listener
Parameters:
caller - the CameraGestureSensor object that made the call
gestureLength - the amount of time the gesture took in milliseconds
